headline: Aunt Teen's Creamy Chocolate Fudge
description: The best fudge recipes are those that have been passed down through the family! Add your favorite nuts to this chocolate fudge for a delicious treat.

video.description: See how to make rich, quick-and-easy fudge.
video.name: Aunt Teen's Creamy Chocolate Fudge

name: Aunt Teen's Creamy Chocolate Fudge

recipeInstructions.text: Line an 8-inch square pan with aluminum foil; set aside.
Combine sugar, marshmallow cream, evaporated milk, butter, and salt together in a large saucepan over medium heat; bring to a full boil and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.

Remove from heat and add milk chocolate chips and semisweet chocolate chips; stir until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Stir in nuts and vanilla. Pour into prepared pan; chill in refrigerator for 2 hours, or until firm.

review.reviewBody: Best fudge recipe

This is the best fudge recipe that I've used here. It's foolproof. Whenever I think I've done something wrong, it comes out perfectly. It's always the creamiest and freshes tasting fudge. I think it's better than candy stores.
Easy to make, delicious results! Tips in the reviews were helpful too.

I did exactly what the recipe asked and the fudge comes out crumbly it is not smooth and creamy and I am a experienced baker. The flavors are good but I will not be making this again . I‚Äôm sorry üòû

I make this every christmas. I DO NOT OVERCOOK this fudge. I add another cup of nuts & cut the chocolate chips down by half. I add whipping cream to evaporated milk to make exactly 2/3 cup. I leave in refrigerator over night & cut up as I need it. It is slightly soft but very creamy just like I like it!!

So happy I found this recipe. This was how my mom made fudge and I also used this recipe. For some reason I lost the recipe and my 70 year old mind couldn‚Äôt remember exactly what the ingredients were. This is the best fudge ever! Christmas is saved!

I have been using this recipe since it first appeared on Allrecipes by Kelly Phillips. That's been many years now and since then it has popped up all over the internet. It is the most delicious fudge and the easiest by far that I've ever made. I have read the reviews and tried the suggestions of others and it bit me in the behind. The recipe is perfect as it's written. In fact the only times it didn't come out perfectly was when I changed it. This is a great recipe and I appreciate Kelly for sharing it so that others can enjoy it.
-6.5 minutes boiling. -Foleys milk choc chips -1 jar marshmallow cr√®me -measure the evaporated milk! -1 tbsp butter - less than called for. -toasted the walnuts first.
Really creamy and delicious. I'll probably use a 9x9 pan next time. I folded in mini marshmallowsafter the chips were melted instead of walnuts.
Made exactly as per recipe, very disappointed, not as creamy as i expected, will not make again and try another receipe.
Delicious and so simple. This was originally called Mamie Eisenhower‚Äôs Fabulous Fudge!

This fudge has an amazing taste. However, in answer to "the most helpful critical review", I took your advice and cooked mine for 6 minutes, and it came out overcooked, hard, crumbly, and does not stick together (the attached image is after I cut out 8 good pieces - all the rest broke apart - and the white lumps are mini-marshmallows I added which helped salvage it a bit). I regret not following the original instructions, since I used up my not-cheap ingredients. :-( Tastes really good, though. Next time I'll go by the instructions. Everyone's stove is different, since I notice others have also said their fudge didn't set in the fridge (and someone said theirs didn't turn out creamy) I think I'd rather have fudge that is too soft than crumbly.
it was sooo goooood

This recipe makes a lot of fudge, as others have said. Very rich fudge. A little too rich, and in an 8x8 pan, the portions are very thick/tall. I could only eat a very small piece. Next time, I will use a 9x13 pan. From other reviews, I was concerned the fudge might not set, so increased the boiling time to 7 minutes. The fudge set perfectly, no refrigeration needed, but wasn't as creamy as I anticipated. Next time, either I'll reduce the boiling time to 6 1/2 minutes and/or boil more gently instead of a full boil. As the motto says, "Practice makes perfect." I believe this recipe will help you achieve fudge "perfection" with a little experimentation.

I have made this same recipe for over 25 years. I have swapped the chocolate amounts, used dark chocolate, used peanut butter in it added and didn't add nuts. No matter how I varied things Aunt Teen always turns out perfect. This is the most perfect fudge recipe you will find. I think this year I might try white chocolate with peppermint! Yum!
So creamy & everyone loves .
This recipe was the only one that I was successful with.. tried 2 others before and failed!! Perfect fudge with great directions! Success!!
LOVE this fudge!!!

This was SUPER easy to make. I LOVE chocolate but this was so rich that I could only eat a little square. And it was not the kind of thing where I couldn't wait to have more. I was good with one piece. I will probably never make it again. It was very creamy.

This is the best tasting fudge, in my opinion, that I‚Äôve ever made. I don‚Äôt think I cooked it long enough, because it stayed fairly soft‚Ä¶..but it was delicious! I left mine in an airtight container - with parchment paper between the layers of fudge - in the fridge until I was ready to serve it. This recipe made a lot of fudge! I used a 9 x 13 pan.

I'm so confused. I made this fudge, anticipating it to be the best. It sat in the fridge overnight and it is still not firm enough to cut squares. I got a blob out and it was delicious, but I can't take it to a friend I made it for. Any hints of what went wrong? As someone had advised, I put half the butter, but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly.
This was my first ever try at fudge and it came out perfect. I love the ease of using these recipes! It tastes wonderful!

Just made this after having made the recipe for Never Fail Fudge a few times.

So far (still waiting for it to cool so I can cut it) based on scraping the bowl, this recipe is MUCH better. Flavor is great, and consistency is great.
I also like that it makes a smaller batch.

One thing I've had an issue with is these recipes all seem to call for removing your pan from the heat, and then stirring in the chips until they're melted and the mixture is smooth. That just doesn't happen with me. It NEVER completely melts the chocolate chips. This time I heated the chips in the microwave while boiling the other ingredients. I use a candy thermometer, so I know I'm at the right temp, but doesn't stay hot long enough to melt the chips.

Lobstah

Good tasting, light and fluffy but a bit too heavy on the marshmallow flavor. Melts/softens and does not hold up shape at room temp. If air dried, it gives a consistency and slight off-taste of a stale marshmallow. Not the traditional fudge recipe I was looking for, but not bad. It‚Äôs a decent alternative to traditional fudge.
This is the best Fudge I have ever made and it's super simple. I doubled the batch, cut the butter called for in half and ta da!! PERFECT smooth, creamy texture!
I double it and use the entire can of evaporated milk and big 16oz jar of fluff for a 13x9 pan.
Best fudge recipe! I did add a few extra tablespoons of the milk and cooked gently on low heat ( not full boil) which gave mu second batch an absolutely smooth and creamy texture.
It was SO good!!!!!!!!!!
perfect recipe - store in a tin in the counter, not fridge
No changes made!!! Turned out perfect and very easy to make!!!!
Yum! I used chocolove chocolate raspberry chocolate bars in place of the chocolate chips. I also sprinkled some freeze dried raspberries on top of the fudge which makes is super pretty!
Very tasty, though very rich and sweet. You only need 1TBS of butter and I found it better to use 2 cups semisweet and 1 cup milk instead of the other way around

I didn't have a problem with this fudge setting. It was easy to make and looked good, but it tasted like I was eating a handful of chocolate chips. I personally didn't care for it. I made 3 types of fudge and this one is the only one still left.
Has a rubbery texture. Won‚Äôt be making this again.
This fudge is wonderful, So very creamy and tasty. Hard not to keep eating it. Also easy to make.

I have made this fudge several times over the years and have followed the recipe to a ‚ÄúT‚Äù every time and have gotten perfect results! This fudge is so creamy and delicious, it is requested by family and friends every year. Thank you for such an easy yet wonderful recipe
Turned out hard and crumbly

This fudge had a great flavor and was easy to make. However, depending on the type of stove you have, be very careful how long you cook. Too much and it can be a bit crumbly. I recommend using a candy thermometer to constantly check temperature while cooking. Take off heat at 232 degrees. 5 minutes may be too long.

This recipe is wonderful! It tastes just like every *expensive* package of fudge I‚Äôve purchased at Ye Olde Fudge Shoppes around the country. No, that‚Äôs not a real store as far as I know.

I went out on a limb and made a double batch and it was still perfect! I took the advice of reviewers and reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup per recipe, and I cut the butter down by 1T per recipe.

Two early reviewers suggested boiling it for 6.5 minutes and another recommended using a candy thermometer to verify that the fudge achieved soft ball stage. I did both and found that 6.5 minutes was just right.

I highly recommend this recipe. I‚Äôll definitely be making it again.
this fudge has the consistency of a truffle. I used more semi sweet than milk chocolate chips. was still sweet without being so sweet you cannot eat it. that is the only thing I changed. enjoy!!
Easy peasy to make & is delicious! Thank you for the recipe!!!

I have made this recipe for the past ten years. It never fails and people always ask for it. Every time I try someone else's, I say to myself, not as good as the one I make. You have to wait to start timing for five minutes as soon as it comes to a rolling boil, stir constantly, don't use generic marshmallow creme, and have your chips and nuts etc ready to mix in right away. I use a full bag of Ghirardelli milk chocolate and half a bag of Ghirardelli semi sweet chips, they are much better than the cheaper ones. It's THE best fudge I have ever made or tasted.

I stuck to recipe and it was wonderful! My only suggestion: ALWAYS put nuts in the oven for a quick roast/toast before putting them in sweets. Toasting the walnuts before putting them in the fudge released a warmer nutty flavor and crisped the walnuts so that it made the fudge even more amazing, and offset some of the sweetness.

I put the nuts in a pie plate and put them in 300 oven for 20 minutes, or until very fragrant. Don't let them go all the way to black, but a nice dark brown is ok.

First time making, read lots of the reviews and tips. Made 3 batches, all came out perfectly. Here is what worked for me. I used only 1 tablespoon of butter. Used all name brand products. Everything was measured out and ready to go. Started the recipe out on low heat, stirring occasionally. Once I saw small bubbles appearing I increased the heat to medium until I decided what I thought was a rolling boil (patience is a virtue here), Do not rush this step. Set a timer for 6.5 minutes and stirred consistently until timer went off. Removed from heat and added the chocolate. Stirred until smooth and then added the vanilla and nuts. I inverted the Semi sweet and milk chocolate in the recipe since I prefer dark chocolate. P.s. I am a novice cook.
Sexellent!
Without question, my favorite chocolate fudge of all time! Awesome flavor and texture. I toasted the chopped pecans I added and that turned out really well.

I haven‚Äôt made fudge in years and was a bit nervous but I read the reviews and cooked for 5 minutes after it started boiling it is perfect! I can‚Äôt believe how easy it was to make and how delicious it is!! Caution, cut into tiny pieces cuz it easy to eat too much, haha.
I made it exactly as it was written. It's very good. Nice and creamy. I'll make it again. Plus, it only makes an 8 x 8 pan. The other recipe I've made used a 13 x 9 pan, that's too much.
Don‚Äôt use marshmallow cream, use 17 regular marshmallows. The jarred cream makes the consistency weird.
Best fudge recipe ever! My son raved about it. Easy to make, very rich and smooth.
Easy and delicious!

I HAVE NEVER MADE FUDGE BEFORE. But I wanted to give it a try because its my hubs favorite sweet. So I followed this recipe to the T but after all set and done, I read a couple of reviews and I didn't bring it up to a rigorous boil! I was freaking out thinking it would not set and it would be an epic fail. But Oh my oh my! IT IS SOLID, IT IS CREAMY, AND IT IS OH SOOO GOOODD! 
I kept a constant stir throughout the whole process, had an even heat for 5 mins. when set in the pan, I kept it out till it reached room temp and then set in the fridge. hubby is going to freak! It really tastes better than all the fudge I have bought at the boardwalks!
Very easy to make, and very tasty.
Simple to make. Taste great.
This fudge is amazing, very creamy. Next time I‚Äôll use more nuts then what is called for in recipe. I highly recommend this.
Excellent and easy!
Yummy! And of course you can add some of your favs, like marshmallows, peanut butter chips, etc. Thanks, have a blessed day!
Smooth and creamy. My new favorite Fudge recipe.
Super easy and delicious! My daughter had fun making it!
Easy and I didn‚Äôt have any milk chocolate chips so used all semisweet - creamy and delicious!!
This is super easy, but you have to watch it and stir constantly. I didn't make a single change and it comes out perfectly every single time. Definitely a keeper.

I made a batch of this in the past and at that time I thought it was good, but I forgot to review. 
This time around I made some changes, as my sweet tooth has changed. I guess old age does that?
The changes I made: Only used 1 cup sugar instead of 1 1/2 cup and added 1 cup frozen little marshmallows at the very end before folding into the prepped pan. I have been looking for a Rocky road fudge & couldn‚Äôt find one that suited me. So I altered this recipe as I knew I had liked it before altering it. 

These changes did not alter the texture, its creamy & melts in your mouth.

I have used this recipe as a base for other fudge flavors, and it turns out perfectly every time! I've made maple walnut fudge with maple chips instead of chocolate, and maple extract instead of vanilla. I've also split a batch in half and done half chocolate chips and half peanut butter chips and layered and swirled them together. this fudge always turns out so buttery smooth and delicious, and my whole family loves it so much!
I make this every christmas eve, and this year everyone loved it so much that all of it was gone in a few hours! Super easy and yummy!

Excellent. No need to tweak the recipe. Just follow the instructions, including stirring for five minutes after it starts boiling, and you will get a great fudge. I discovered this recipe two months ago and have made it at least ten times. The reviews have been wonderful!
Super easy, came out fantastic.

Delicious and creamy. I read several comments regarding the sugar and butter reduction as well as the cooking time increase BEFORE I made it. Thank you to those commenters.
This was my first time making fudge. I'm excited to make it in the future for parties, etc.
Perfect! Don't start 5 minute timer until it's really rolling or just boil 6 1/2 minutes as soon as it starts to boil. I've made it 4 times & it's just great! Thanks
My husband loves fudge, so using some of the suggestions in the comments, my husband said this was very good fudge. I will be making it again.
Used peppermint oil instead of vanilla, and added crushed peppermint on top. Will definitely make again, loved it!

I made it just as the recipe stated only added 1/2 tsp of peppermint extract and rolled it into bonbons, some coated with crushed candy cane, others cocoa and jimmies. Just like I remember my mom making all thise years ago. Delish!
Loved this recipe. Super tasty and super easy. First time I ever made fudge and this recipe was a huge hit at Xmas!! Whoever Aunt teen is I owe her a big thank you!!!!

Very easy. I did two batches. First one with walnuts and I may not have boiled it long enough as the fudge got super soft when left out (no substance). The second batch with almonds and that turned out way better (I made sure I boiled it longer). With both batches, I added double the nuts
This is fantastic, classic fudge. So creamy and smooth. I could not stop eating it.

This is hands down the easiest fudge recipe that I have ever used. It never fails. If you like dark chocolate like I do, you can use 2 cups semi sweet and 1 cup milk chocolate. I make it both ways. They are both delicious.
Everyone loved it!!!

I have been using this fudge recipe every year during our family Christmas candy making day for the past 7 years or so. It is the creamiest fudge recipe I have come across and quite frankly I have stopped buying fudge because I haven‚Äôt found a fudge that I like better than mine (due to this recipe)! I follow the recipe to the ‚Äút‚Äù and it is THE best fudge recipe.

Followed the directions exactly, then added a layer of white chocolate with cr√®me de menthe to Christmas it up a bit.
It kicks proverbial gluteus maximus.
Wonderful and creamy! Would highly recommend it

I'm a chef and there are a few ways to mess this easy recipe up. First, do NOT add the marshmallow fluff to the sugar and milk. Simply place the marshmallow in with the chocolate.
(I do micro the fluff for 20 seconds to help it get out of the jar, and I also slightly micro the chocolate.)

You can use less butter. 1 to 2 tablespoons max.

You can vary the type of chocolate. I like even amounts of semi and milk chocolate.

Here's where most people go wrong. You need to bring the milk and sugar to a slow, very slow, boil. People are putting the burner too hot. (med is the max you should use) and/or boiling it too long.
When the mixture begins to boil, (a few bubbles) start the 5-minute timer. I check the temp with a good digital thermometer. When it hits 230 degrees Fahrenheit lower the burner heat to low. 

I slightly heat the milk first and slowly add the sugar. I stir constantly. My fudge comes out perfect every time.

Researched all the suggestions and decided to not add the marshmallow til the end of the 5 minutes mainly because my other fudge recipe is done that way and also cause many suggested it on here. I cooked it for 5 min 30 seconds. Used only the name brand marshmallow fluff and choc chips. Had everything pre measured out and ready to add and stir. My last step was the choc chips and it instantly became stiff and crumbly and dry. Pretty much inedible and super dry. I am not a novice baker and have made plenty of fudge. Pretty upset at a waste of time and money *sigh* Perhaps if i had started off with the marshmallow creme in the pan right away but i dont know :(
Very good! I did begin the stirring before a full boil, and also stirred for 7 minutes instead of 5

After looking for that perfect fudge recipes over the years, I finally stopped when I found this one. As far as I‚Äôm concerned, Aunt Teen is an expert in fudge making. I estimate I‚Äôve made this recipe at *least* 25 times, and each time it has turned out delicious. I follow the recipe exactly as written, but I use quality ingredients, a heavier pot and a wooden spoon. Also have all of your ingredients ready, because you have to stir this constantly on med-low heat so it doesn‚Äôt scorch. Wait for it to get to a moderate rolling boil, then start timing your 5 minutes, otherwise it can be too soft. The ratio of milk chocolate to semi sweet is perfect (and for those who say it‚Äôs too sweet..it‚Äôs fudge..it‚Äôs supposed to be sweet!). I do store it in the fridge, because it is a softer, creamier type of fudge (some reviewers have suggested cooking it an extra minute or two, but I‚Äôm afraid that might make it dry). I cut it in 1 inch by 1 inch pieces and keep it covered with plastic wrap. Whenever I have a chocolate craving, this stuff satisfies perfectly, especially around Christmas. I compare all fudge to this recipe‚Äîincluding stores who make it and sell it, and most of them don‚Äôt compare to this stuff. Aunt Teen‚Äîyou rock!

This fudge is great! My advice is to have your chocolate chips premeasured so you can just dump them right in. This doesn't last longer than 3 days in my house. Even my friend who swore to me she hated fudge loved it. It's a keeper!!!
Found this and never looked further. Great.
This recipe was the bomb. My family & friends love it.
I made this recipe for my daughter-in-law's birthday. It was a hit! Chocolatey, silky and so delicious.

This is the only fudge recipe that I use. I make loads of it for Christmas and give it out as gifts. I get compliments about how good it is, so of course I will keep using this same recipe. Thanks for sharing. It's fanfudgetastic! That was corny, but that's who I am.
I made the fudge with the semi sweet chocolate but I used white chocolate instead of milk chocolate. Came out Awesome!
So easy and so delicious.
Perfect as written! I made a double batch for Christmas and there was none left by New Year's.
This was a great recipe so easy turned out amazing !

Mom used to make the recipe off the Marshmellow Cream jar back in the '70's. For this recipe, I used a 12 oz. bag of semi sweet chocolate chips, 3/4 cup of sugar and 1/4 cup of Stevia blend. Turned out great!
This turned out delicious!!! I did boil for 7 min, as several reviews recommended. ( I remember "7 min fudge"). I used generic marshmallow cream. I had soooo many compliments. Very creamy

This is a delicious fudge recipe. The only fudge I have made before was cream cheese fudge and it needed to be refrigerated. This is quick and easy! I made it on Christmas Eve in the morning and gave it as treats that evening.

Amazing better than 10 pound fudge at any candy shop. Next time I use bettt brand chocolate chips just to see but Nestle chips were amazing. I also used pure cane sugar instead of white sugar My grandkids are raving and my son said best fudge he ever eaten !!
Smooth and creamy fudge. Everyone that tried it loved it. Will definitely be making this again!

I made too many modifications to make a fair assessment of this recipe but it really got me started towards a wonderful pan of fudge. I used dark chocolate chips and semi-sweet chips instead of milk chocolate. I also added a large handful of mini-marshmallows to melt with the marshmallow cream.

I brought the ingredients to 236 degrees using a candy thermometer and then added the chocolate chips. As I started stirring, the whole thing seized up into a solid mass . Didn't turn out at all. I think the key is the add the marshmallow cream after bringing the fudge to temperature because another recipe on this website (The Original Fantasy Fudge) worked perfectly.
